application.description: Neutrality.ca, Canada's largest Net Neutrality Campaign, is a multi-lingual site based on Zend Framework. It has been featured on the National news and relates to a significant policy debate at the highest levels of government.

One of our production sites is webArgos (www.webargos.com). It uses a lot of the Zend Framework components, including Acl, Auth, Config, Controller, Date, Db, Json, Mail, and Registry. It has guest, client, and admin modules to separate the functionality of each. Acl and Auth are used together to control access to each part. Db interacts with a PostgreSQL database, and we use Mail to automatically send notifications to our users. We use Zend_Json to send AJAX responses to the browser that are handled by our JavaScript. A couple other production applications that use Zend Framework are personal.apprize360.com and www.dewoods.com. We also have a couple other sites that use parts of the framework, which we plan to upgrade at some point to make use of the entire framework.

We have used various components of Zend Framework for the relaunch of Neu.de, one of the biggest online dating platforms in Germany. Neu.de has average number of users of something around 7000. We have actually used Zend_XmlRpc_Client, Zend_Http_Client, Zend_Session, Zend_Filter and Zend_Validator.

Multiple WebApplications (closed source) for speech recording and data collection services. All in production, voxlog.voxtronic.com (demo demo). Uses Zend_Locale, Zend_Date, Zend_Db, Zend_Session, Zend_Translate, Zend_Cache, Zend_XmlRpc, Zend_Exception, Zend_Mail, Zend_Log, Zend_Validate, and Zend_View.

I'm developing a commercial financial system, which will consist of core applications for General Ledger, Accounts Payable, and Accounts Receivable, as well as a suite of other important line-of-business applications that will integrate with the core apps. The system is targeted at local governments and small to medium businesses. Uses: ACL, Auth, Cache, Db, Locale, Log, Mail, Registry, Session...

See http://www.contentwatch.com and http://www.netnanny.com. We are using Zend Framework to power not only our public website and online store, but our partner portal and customer relationship management as well. In conjunction with our own in-house libraries has made development and deployment much easier.
We are currently working on the next generation open source eCommerce platform, Magento. It is based on Zend Framework and pending to be released in August, 2007.

I've developed Peo CMS which is content management system based on ZF 1.0.0RC1. It handles content management, users management, newsletter, and everything is internationalized. Two sites created using Peo CMS: http://yellow.pl/ & http://nasylwestra.pl/. Uses: Zend_Acl, Zend_Auth, Zend_Cache, Zend_Config, Zend_Controller, Zend_Db, Zend_Debug, Zend_Log, Zend_Loader, Zend_Locale, Zend_Mail, Zend_Session, Zend_Translate, Zend_View
Legal software for a governmental organization. Uses: MVC components with Zend_DB (Oracle), Zend_Auth and Zend_Acl
Simple Poll system. Users can create, edit polls. There are three types of answers: radio,checkbox and input (open question). Uses: Zend_Db_*, MVC

PAGE - Supplies ordering system for the 500 primary schools of the city of Marseille. Allows schools headmasters and teachers to order stationeries and other items from the different suppliers endorsed by the City. More than 2000 users spending 3 M Euros. In production since the beginning of May 2007. Uses: Zend_Db, Zend_Json, Zend_Controller. Plans to use Zend_Db_Table.
GUEPA - SSO application used by PAGE and other applications to come. Contains all information and privileges of schools members for the city of Marseille. Queried via SOAP. in Production.

The current available version is over 5 years old. We are currently developing a complete rewrite with ZF. It will become a social event/invitations community. Uses: Zend_Cache, Zend_Controller, Zend_Date, Zend_Db, Zend_Feed, Zend_Filter, Zend_Filter_Input, Zend_Mail, Zend_Registry, Zend_Validate, Zend_View
Email marketing software, providing the required functionality to allow non-technical users to compose html based mail messages and to manage by themselves lists of contacts

http://www.esphotography.co.uk/ Shopping Cart, CMS, Horses for Sale adverts pages, Contact email form and MySQL based sessions all fully built using ZF. Uses: MVC, Db (and Db_Table), Session, Registry, Config and Mail.
http://hitask.com A Web2.0 task management site. Uses: Mail, Feeds.

Maya's Mom, the premiere social network site for parents is built using Zend Framework. http://www.mayasmom.com/ Uses: The overall Zend Framework structure for routing, controllers as well as Zend DB for data access. Zend Framework is flexible and allows us to use our pre-existing Smarty templates for the view.

One Wishlist (http://onewishlist.net/) - a universal wishlist website that isn’t tied to individual online shops. Create a wishlist, tell your friends and receive the gifts you want. Your list can include gifts from all online and offline stores, even from the special gift shop at the end of the road.
The site was originally built using version 0.7 of the Zend framework. We keep a test version updated to work with the latest version of the framework and will be launching this as soon after the 1.0 release of the framework as we can. The site uses the MVC structure from the framework, the registry and one or two other bits. We will be using Zend_Service and some of the specific services in the future. We use or own database access layer; because it was already developed, we like it, and it was easy to integrate it with Zend Framework.

I used Zend Framework to develop a document managing system (upload/download, user permissions, etc) and it's currently in production on the company's intranet. Uses: MVC parts, registry, config, db/tables, log and more.
The community news site PHPDeveloper.org is run entirely on the framework. http://www.phpdeveloper.org
Used ZFW to build an intranet for a high school. Uses: Zend_Controller, Zend_Session, Zend_Acl, Zend_Auth, and Zend_Cache, Zend_Log, and Zend_Validate.

An app for non-profits to enable them to create and run fund drives. Members can create a personalized version of the drive and email friends/associates, asking them to sponsor them and contribute online to the fund drive. Uses Zend_Controller, Zend_Acl, Zend_Date, Zend_Auth, Zend_Config, and Zend_Registry. http://www.personalfunddrive.com/

I have used the framework as the basis for my startup, "Octabox", which is a web platform for online productivity, sharing and collaboration. It is in private alpha at the moment, and can be found at http://www.octabox.com. Uses: The entire Zend_Db class hierarchy, Zend_Filter and Zend_Validate through Zend_Filter_Input, The entire Zend_Controller class hierarchy, Zend_View, Zend_Search_Lucene, Zend_Session, Zend_Auth, Zend_Json, Zend_Registry. I plan to add in the near future extensive use of the Zend_Cache and Zend_Acl components.

The NTS (Dutch transplant foundation) uses an application built with ZF to register information off deceased patients in Dutch hospitals. We have used the ZF controller and view components with a custom model implementation based on a php version of iBatis. The application will be in production from july 2007.
A web interface to manage subversion repositories. http://www.usvn.info

The website is owned by one of the major paper-based newspapers in Bulgaria. It is a general classifieds website based on ZF 0.9.3. Used: Zend_DB, Zend_DB_Select, Zend_Registry, Zend_Cache, Zend_StripTags, etc.
Newsletter System for business customers of the novotel Hotel Group in Berlin/Germany. http://www.novotel-berlin.com
